definition: to rear (an animal) in an enclosure
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Dogs and horses raised in captivity are way better to eat than endangered whales poached from the wild.
sentences.chinese: 喫圈養的狗和馬至少要比喫快絕種的鯨魚好。

sentences.english: Store-fed animals are fed on maize, wheat and barley in the race to fatten them up as fast as possible.
sentences.chinese: 圈養牲畜則是用玉米小麥和大麥儘快的催肥而成的。

sentences.english: Captive animals should not be inoculated against smallpox.
sentences.chinese: 不應爲圈養動物接種天花疫苗。

sentences.english: The one-year-old shark is the longest surviving great white in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 該一歲的鯊魚，是圈養大白鯊中存活最久的。

sentences.english: The Codian Moon maintains reek ranches.
sentences.chinese: 在科迪亞衛星上有圈養力克的牧場。

sentences.english: Humanity is now the world's longest living snake in captivity, local time, 27 died.
sentences.chinese: 人類目前圈養的世界最長活蛇於當地時間27日死亡。

sentences.english: This part of the field has been divided off with a fense, to keep the cows in.
sentences.chinese: 這塊地已用籬笆隔開，以便把牛圈養在內。

sentences.english: Humans are not meant to be raised in cages.
sentences.chinese: 人類本就不該被慣在籠子裏被圈養。

sentences.english: Hunted and penned in an inglorious spot.
sentences.chinese: 被捕捉並圈養在卑劣的豬欄。

sentences.english: Part of the reserve's mission includes placing the pandas it has bred back into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 保護區的職責之一就是將圈養的熊貓放歸野外。

sentences.english: Near his house stood the ancient barn that housed the familys goats and chickens.
sentences.chinese: 他家附近有座舊穀倉，是用來圈養山羊和雞的。

sentences.english: Pietsch says the fact that Knut died at the age of 4 is very unusual, noting that polar bears kept in captivity often live up to 30 years or more.
sentences.chinese: 通常圈養的北極熊可以活到30歲左右。

sentences.english: The great majority of barn owls are reared in captivity .
sentences.chinese: 絕大多數倉鴞都是圈養的。

sentences.english: Strabo states that the ferret was bred in captivity in Libya and used for hunting rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 斯特拉博記述在利比亞雪貂誕生後被圈養並用於捕兔。

definition: to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to carry on one's ancestral line
population (of a species)/community (of animals or plants)
to be eradicated/to vanish/extinct/to break off relations
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
